name: Nest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marko and Sally could (and maybe should) write the book on how to create, own and run the perfect bed and breakfast. Every touch has been carefully planned and perfectly executed. Ammenities abound at this gem of an inn. There are steam showers in each room, a fabulous game room and an enjoyable breakfast nook perfect for enjoying the outdoors whilst indoors. In addition, Nest is the perfect getaway for any season since Marko and Sally thought to put in a pool AND a hot tub. Finally, you will be amazed by Marko's fantastic culinary creations. Make a reservation...you will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Five Star BnB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not have asked for a better place to stay during our trip to the Poconos. The hosts, Sally and Marko, are wonderful; they're very social and knowledgeable, and they have mastered the perfect mix of being readily available and letting couples have their space. They provided plenty of information on things to do with recommendations for restaurants and activities along with brochures and maps. The house is amazing in a beautiful wooded area with a great game room, wonderful shared-space, and decks complete with a pool and hot tub perfect for star-gazing. While the private rooms are not suites, the accomodations were spacious enough and had everything we needed. We did not take advantage of their spa packages, but they have great studio space for a couples massage. Breakfast was fantastic every day. Also, don't let the presence of a dog, Tulo, scare you off if you are allergic to dogs; the dog is hypoallergenic, and while I was skeptical, my dog allergies were not bothered in the slightest by him even after spending time playing with him. Overall, we couldn't have picked a better B+B. Highly Recommended.
reviews.title: Worth every penny ... the perfect weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a wonderful time - Nest is the perfect getaway with a loved one. Great ambiance, location, activities and food. Marko and Sally are very kind and know how to make you feel right at home. The room had everything you could want and was charming and clean. We hiked, got massages, drank wine, and ate. It was all the peace, relaxation, and fun that we could have hoped for. We left feeling so good that we want to go back!
reviews.title: Love Birds' nest : the Perfect Weekend for Two!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent this past weekend in at The Nest B&B with my husband, 6 month old daughter, and a close family friend. We all had a lovely and relaxing time. The house was so serene and peaceful, and the grounds (especially the pool and Jacuzzi) were amazing! Marco and Sally were the perfect hosts. Breakfasts, my favorite meal of the day, were amazing. We had dinner at the house one evening, and the home cooked family style meal made us all feel like we were dining with old friends. I especially loved the new addition to the house, Tullo, their a goofy and lovable Labradoodle. All in all it was a stellar weekend away from the city, and were hoping to make it an annual trip!
reviews.title: A lovely weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A perfect 3 day getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Girlfriend and i arrived a few hours before check in time on Friday afternoon to find Marko cleaning the rooms from the previous guests, he was nice enough to allow us entry to the room as we were both trying to get over some pretty nasty colds and werent in the best moods.
reviews.title: We can't wait to go back in the summer
A pleasant little getaway
reviews.text: Nest is gorgeous, it's as nice, if not nicer than the pictures on their website. You must remove your shoes when you enter, as this helps keeps Nest that much more clean. The kitchen is huge and gorgeous with a nice wood burning stove, the dining area is big and open and offers a view of the woods adjacent to the property. Marko also has about a 1/2 dozen bird feeders just outside the windows of the dining area, the wild finches offer a nice show.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are super clean and nicely decorated with great views. The bed is very comfortable, but the star of the show was the steam shower, what a gift this was, especially with us both having colds, we must've used this shower 5 times in the two days we were there. The steam works wonders on the sinuses and clears you right up.
reviews.title: Fabulous hideaway getaway....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Nest. Marco and Sally were wonderful hosts. We had looked for B+Bs in the Poconos, and to be honest, most had very stuffy and old rooms. We found the Nest to be very different. This was our first trip to the Poconos, so it's hard to compare the Nest to other accomodations, but it would have to be a really great place to top this. You get a top notch pool and use of the jacuzzi. The dinner recommendations were excellent. And Marco and Sally leave you alone, but are not absent. We really appreciated that. Breakfasts were very nice and they even made heart shaped French toast for us lovebirds.
reviews.title: Excellent B+B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend of bliss at Nest. I am 7th months pregnant and the owners Sally & Marko really made me so comfortable. We were celebrating my husband’s 30th birthday and they accommodated all of my special requests above and beyond. The house was amazing! Design and decor were really special and the grounds/landscaping was really incredible. It was so quiet and peaceful. Our room was very spacious and clean and the bathroom with steam shower was such a wonderful amenity. We really enjoyed the game room and played pool, table tennis and the pinball machines into the wee hours of the night. The pool and hot tub were absolutely stunning and even though the owners live at the house, we felt we had plenty of privacy and seclusion the entire trip. We had a fantastic couples massage provided at the house by the local spa. The breakfasts were gourmet and they even accommodated my husband’s favorite, banana chocolate chip pancakes for his birthday. We are already planning our next trip back with friends before our baby is born. I would highly recommend Nest, if not for the amazing house, amenities and hosts, then for the hiking & wildlife opportunities surrounding.
reviews.title: Spectacular Weekend Getaway for 30th Birthday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved every aspect of our stay!!! Our room and private bath were spacious, immaculate and beautifully designed. We loved the game room too!! Breakfast was excellent. And our hosts were friendly and accommodating in every way. They gave us suggestions for hiking and dining, (all of which were great!) We will definitely return and highly recommend it to others!!!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got home from a wonderful long weekend in the Poconos, and our stay at Nest Bed was one of the highlights of the trip. The innkeepers, Marko and Sally, are generous and welcoming with their beautiful home. It is such a relaxing environment. The room are wonderful -- spacious, clean and well kept, but not crowded and overstuffed like so many B & Bs. You really feel like you can stretch out and relax. And, the steam shower in the room is a great addition -- especially after a day enjoying all of the great outdoor activities that the area has to offer. Breakfast was wonderful, and the conversation with Marko & Sally as well as the other guests was fantastic. And, what could be better than a friendly greeting from their sweet new dog. Also, Marko and Sally know everyone in the area, so they were incredibly helpful with recommendations for activities and meals. All in all, a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: A wonderful treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a wonderful weekend with my husband at Nest. Marco and Sally were truly wonderful hosts - so friendly and welcoming. They really made us feel at home - always ready to talk, fill us in on great restaurants and things to do around town. My husband and I work during the week in NYC and being able to drive such a short distance but really feel away from the city is a great feeling. The house itself was spotless. The rooms were super cozy, decorated extremely tastefully and very very comfortable. Extra surprises that really set this place apart were the wood burning stove in the kitchen and the steam shower (like a personal sauna!). And every morning the breakfast was really out of this world and extremely fresh and tasty. We went skiing at Shawnee and Marco got us a great deal with lift tickets. Nest was the perfect distance from Shawnee while still maintaining individuality and charm that the large commercial and touristy hotels and resorts do not have. Overall a great experience! (and as a side note, if you get a chance eat at the Fork at Twin Lakes - it was amazing! even to our city tastebuds. Marco and Sally recommended the restaurant and it was truly a find).
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

description: Nest Bed is a luxury 2 room B&B with lots of amenities, set on a private wooded site within 2 hours of the New York and Philly metro areas. We have access to miles of hiking and nearby access to the Delaware River. Enjoy our seasonal heated pool and year round hot tub, or arrange for a massage in our massage studio.
